cboCostEstimates.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on the Judiciary on September 30, 2021
cboCostEstimates.title: H.R. 2116, CROWN Act of 2021

constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 52 (Friday, March 19, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. WATSON COLEMAN:
H.R. 2116.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8: Congress shall have the power to make
all laws which shall he necessary and proper for carrying
into execution the foregoing powers and all other powers
vested by this Constitution in the government of the United
States.
[Page H1613]

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
